question: What dimension are you using to slice this increment thinner?
options: Users - target specific roles or contexts first (e.g., tablet app for store associates only)
Workflow - implement simple workflow paths before complex variants (e.g., notify only successful applicants)
Interfaces - limit interaction channels (e.g., online only, no in-branch)
Data Variations - process one data type first (e.g., monitor only redemption rate)
Environment - target specific technology or physical means (e.g., out-of-store only)
Business Rule Variations - implement limited constraints initially (e.g., limited fraud rules)
Subjective Quality - reduce NFRs for early adopters (e.g., 50 users, lower performance targets)
Spike - extremely rough implementation thrown away after getting desired learning
